review_blob: Beautiful trappist beer. Strong, dark, yeasty, complex, warming. Perfect. No complains.

Pours a very dark copper colour, hazy with a nice looking thin white head. Wonderful aroma, fruits, caramel, very well hidden alcohol. Sweet, but bitter finish. Medium body. Creamy texture. Good carbonation due to refermentation in the bottle. Overall an amazing abbey dubbel, perhaps not the best of all the Trappist beers, but definitely worth every cent (which, by the way, are a lot of cents...). Salut!

Pours a beautiful hazy orange colour, with a typical average Hefe Weizen aroma of banana, cloves, and no hops. The finish, however, is particularly dissapointing. Good carbonation though. Overrated beer, cant understand how come it has a higher rating than Schneider Weisse Original.
As it says on the deScription, simply bigger than the classic Mrzen style. Smoky. Urbock. Simple. Great.

Caramel aroma, lots of fruitiness, just a small hint of alcohol. Amber orange, totally clear, which was a surprise. Very creamy head and quite long lasting. Very sweet taste, malty. Light medium body with a average finish. Good carbonation and pretty creamy feel in the mouth. Overall worth trying it if you like light bock beers.

Complex aroma, some fruits, some maltiness, some caramel... Pours very dark brown, good lasting head, nice carbonation. Pretty sweet. Long finish. Medium body? Medium to full perhaps. Overall one of the best trappists beers Ive ever tasted and, whether you like the (strong) style or not, worth a try!
Very dark colour, as expected from the style. Poor brown head. Roasty flavour, short finish. Not the best beer but not bad for a dark lager.

Very appealing bottle pours a nice creamy head protecting a dark ruby Mrzen. Not hazy at all. Huge smoky aroma, reminds of any kind of smoky meat. Medium body, quite sweet, long finish. Overall a very interesting beer and if you enjoy the style, youll love this.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Just one of the best beers ever. If you like beer with character, you will love this. It has one of the best carbonation levels Ive ever seen. Absolutely first class beer.
Simply one of the most disgusting beers in the market. Water with some gas and alcohol.
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2013
Its not a too bad mrzen. Its got flavour, body and good carbonation, only bad thing its that, as far as I remember, its got rice in it!!! WHY!?? Anyways, (a bit) above average beer.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Great weizenbock, clean in flavour, hazy in appearance. Schneider Weisse never dissapoints me.
Watery, no real flavour, skunky, metallic aroma, no head, artificial carbonation.... I Hate this kind of shitty commercial beers and wish they all go to hell (which aint gonna happen unfortunately..)
This is nothing like it used to be. Too much like a commercial lager. Sorry, wont buy it again, specially for its price.

50 cl bottle. Caramel, roasty aroma and quite hoppy. Good aroma and better appearance, almost black colour, tones of pretty dark red/amber. Good brown thick head. Perhaps quite a weak flavour. Still, a very drinkable dark beer.
Not bad at all, orange flavour and a typical witbier. Cant complain much about this.

I must admit this is something different. Thats for sure. Still, I dont find it very nice. If you like vanilla flavours in drinks with already a fruity character and if you enjoy whiskey.. Probably youll like this. Light/medium body, nice head that dissappears quickly. Not my kind of beer, yet I admit its different from others. Prost!
Very good beer, nice and soft, refreshing with a remarkably balanced taste, with a very fruity flavour, good creamy head and beautiful aroma. Overall a very tasty drink.
Reminds me a lot of a Schneider Weisse with its amber colour, more body than a normal wheat beer, stronger. Still a very refreshing beer for those summer days comin soon! Prost!

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: 500 ml bottle. Poured into my preferred weizen glass. Approximately 5C. This is actually one of my favourites beers of them all. Its a very special hefe-weizen, darker, of amber colour, more "spicy" than others, stronger... Apart from this, quite similar to a normal Hefe-Weizen, particularly cloudy and orange, clove and banana flavours. Long finish. Beautiful long-lasting white thick head. Perfect balance, sweet and lively carbonation. Overall an incredible beer. Prost!

Honestly I cant understand why some people give this beer a below-average rate. Beautiful cloudy golden beer, kind of orange colour. Perhaps not as much banana aroma as usual for a Hefe-Weizen but instead a bit of, again, orange! Pretty sweet, medium body Id say, nice creamy texture. Definetely better and more intense taste than aroma. Overall a top quality Hefe-Weizen! If you like this great beer style, youll love this Julius Echter! Prost!

This is a non-alcoholic beer!! What do you want?? Obviously it wont be as good as a normal weizen but come on!! Its pretty tasty and nice for a 0.5% abv!! Medium body, quite sweet, not a bad head, perhaps too little carbonation for me. Overall I say its a very enjoyable alcohol free drink. And it definitely has a strong wheat flavour!
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013

If you like something that looks like a beer but tastes like a kind of soft drink.. .Then this is your drink! Ok, apart from that.... It lacks of body, aroma, head, character... Still, its very soft, no bad alcohol taste and very refreshing in a warm summer day. Thats why Im giving it a 2.
Cask, toast and chocolate aroma, lovely dark colour with an average white head. Light sweetness, in my opinion perfect for a mild. Short dry finish. Very enjoyable beer.

They claim to be the "lteste brauerei der Welt" (or the oldest brewery in the world). When some business is able to satisfy its clients for sooo many years... It must have a reason. And this Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier is THE only reason... Banana and clove aroma with a hint of vanilla perhaps, cloudy appearance, thick white creamy long-lasting head, golden colour... Just for its appearance and aroma it deserves the best position of all! Then.. Once you drink the first sip you start understanding why the brewery has been running for so long... Incredibly refreshing, medium sweetness, very balanced, medium body with perfect average carbonation, creamy texture, long and again sweet finish... Just amazing. Drunk from tap and bottle, it doesnt matter its impressive in every way. PROST!

Drunk form tap. Nothing special, the only good things to remark  are the white thick head that stayed for long, the beautiful aroma and the hazy appearance. Not enough sweetness and little wheat flavour for me.

Funnily enough Ive never tried this from a bottle. On my trip to Prague I drank several from the tap, in beautiful taverns and I have to say this is one of my favourite pilsner beers, and I must admit its not my favourite style of beer. Its not worth it going into details... Just an extraordinary beer.

One of the best Asturian ciders that Ive ever tried. Needs to be poured the right way. Lovely apple aroma and taste. Very refreshing. Personally I rather drink it cool, but some locals prefer it at room temperature. In anyway its a hell of a cider. Great adquisition (though quite expensive abroad)

Problem with this is that many people dont know how to drink it. First you need to hold the bottle over your head and then pour it into a wide glass that has to be almost at your knees. You pour a small quantity and drink it all at once. Do that process and THEN rate it. I think its a extraordinary cider, tipycal Asturian cider, much more sour than the sweet English cider (in my opinion, inferior to the Asturian cider). Again please, Id ask everyone to do the right process before drinking it. If you just pour half the bottle into a glass and drink it it will probably be awful. Id also recommend everyone to visit Asturias in northern Spain to try this kind of (very different) cider and the "escanciado" (pouring) process that it involves.
Toasted malt, some alcohol aroma. almost black colour, short-lasting head. Light body, average/high carbonation and abrupt finish.

As soon as it is poored into the pint glass we get a strong hint of coffee which is ratified afterwards in its taste. Black colour with a very long-lasting and thick head. full body, thick feel, average/soft carbonation and long finish. An incredible beer for quite an affordable price.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013

Average low-cost beer. Cant expect anything else from this! alcohol aroma, no fruit at all. Very very light body. Even worse taste. It should be drunk really chilled!! (To hide its horrible taste...) Overall very poor perfomance.
Awful, just awful. Lack of body, thin texture, very very poor head... Nothing I would ever recommend!

Astonishing beer. I personally believe that the most famous products are not necessarily the better ones (e.g. heineken, fosters, carlsberg, etc. If someone disagrees with me please dont hesitate to contact me and discuss it!! But I do believe all those (and many more) brands are quite disappointing). And though this Hefe-Weizen may not be as well-known as a Paulaner or Franziskaner... Its still remarkably nice!
Hazy appearance as in a usual weissbier, good frothy head that helps the maintenance after the pooring (always in a tall hefe-weizen glass!!)
Distelhuser is of medium/heavy sweetness, with some banana and cloves tastes but not too much. Average carbonation, maybe too little for my preferences, and that could be the only bad thing Id say about this beer!
Prost!

Drank this for the first time during my amazing trip to St Petersburg in a nice pub in the city centre. It is just an average refreshing beer. Thats all. Dont try to find anything else with this beer, you wont! 
Still, its pretty drinkable.

Quite an extraordinary beer, golden colour, pretty clear, not messy at all. White lasting head. Light sweetness, medium body, I would say average/high carbonation, long finish.
Pretty enjoyable on a nice evening alone or with company.
I would certainly recommend it!

One small drawback is certainly the usual price for a small bottle, especially in countries like the UK or Spain. It could make this beer non-affordable for a daily basis to many people!
